procedure.name: General Dental Procedures
covered_procedures: Administration of medications, anesthesia, and sedation
procedure.description: This consent covers a broad range of general dental procedures, diagnostics, restorative, surgical, cosmetic, periodontal, and endodontic treatments as deemed necessary during care.

risks_and_complications: Allergic reactions to medications including antibiotics, analgesics, anesthetics, and sedation drugs
Drowsiness, impaired coordination, or loss of awareness following medication or sedation
Pain, swelling, infection, or delayed healing
Spread of infection or need for additional treatment or hospitalization
Temporary or permanent nerve injury causing numbness or altered sensation (paresthesia)
Temporomandibular joint (TMJ) pain, popping, clicking, or locking
Post-treatment tooth sensitivity or restoration failure
Failure of root canal treatment or need for additional surgical procedures (apicoectomy)
Looseness, soreness, breakage, or need for relining of dentures
Cosmetic limitations including inability to perfectly match natural tooth color
Increased risk of poor outcomes if post-treatment instructions are not followed
Reduced effectiveness of oral contraceptives when taking antibiotics
alternatives_to_treatment: Root canal therapy instead of extraction
Crowns, periodontal surgery, or other restorative procedures

scope: Administration of medications, anesthesia, and sedation
Modification or addition of procedures during treatment if necessary
authorization.text: I authorize the dentist to perform recommended dental procedures and to make necessary changes or additions to the treatment plan as conditions are discovered during treatment.

fields: Parent or Legal Guardian Signature (if applicable)
